concise_definition: adj. 被报道的, 据称的; v. 报道, 报告 (report 的过去式和过去分词)

definitions.explanation_en: Describing something that has been stated or communicated by others, often without direct confirmation or personal observation; implying secondhand information.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指由他人陈述或传播的信息，通常未经直接证实或个人观察，暗示信息来源于他人转述。
definitions.example_en: The reported number of casualties was higher than the official count.
definitions.example_cn: 据报的伤亡人数高于官方统计。

definitions.explanation_en: To communicate information about an event, situation, or fact to others, especially through media or official channels.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指通过媒体或官方渠道向他人传达有关事件、情况或事实的信息。
definitions.example_en: The newspaper reported that the mayor had resigned.

definitions.explanation_en: To formally present or submit information, often in a professional or official context, such as a report to a supervisor or authority.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在专业或正式场合中正式提交或呈报信息，例如向上级或权威机构提交报告。
definitions.example_en: She reported her findings to the board at the end of the quarter.
definitions.example_cn: 她在季度末向董事会汇报了她的研究结果。

comparison.analysis: “Stated” (陈述的) 强调信息是由某人明确说出或写下的，通常具有直接性和确定性，来源明确。而 “reported” 暗示信息是间接获得的，可能经过转述，不一定由原始来源直接确认。
“Claimed” (声称的) 带有主观性甚至怀疑色彩，暗示说话者可能缺乏充分证据或意图说服他人。而 “reported” 更中性，常用于新闻或正式语境，强调信息的传播行为而非其真实性。
“Announced” (宣布的) 通常指由权威或官方主体主动、公开地发布信息，具有正式性和意图性。而 “reported” 更侧重于信息的传递过程，发布者可能是记者、目击者或第三方，不一定具有权威性。
